node.title: Man arrested over alleged hit-and-run crash at COVID-19 testing site in Melbourne
node.alt: Blue and white police tape at a crime scene.
node.description: Police say emergency services were called to the corner of Easey and Hoddle streets in Collingwood about 9:25am after reports a white Holden station wagon hit a pedestrian then fled the scene.
node.content: ["Police have arrested a man over an alleged hit-and-run crash at a COVID-19 testing site in inner-Melbourne this morning.", "Emergency services were called to the corner of Easey and Hoddle streets about 9:25am after reports a white Holden station wagon hit a pedestrian then fled the scene.", "Police said a\u00a0nearby nurse gave first aid to the injured pedestrian, a man in his 50s from Tarneit, before he was taken to hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.", "The ABC understands the injured person was a worker with cohealth, which operates the testing site at its Collingwood health clinic.", "\"A short time later, police located the vehicle and arrested the male driver at an address in Leicester Street, Carlton,\" Victoria Police said in a statement.", "Police are still investigating the circumstances of the crash and said the man was assisting with inquiries.", "\"It's believed witnesses observed the vehicle driving erratically near the Melbourne CBD,\" Victoria Police said.", "Anyone with dashcam footage or more information has been urged to contact Crime Stoppers.", "More to come."]
